stories.text:
I've lamented here many times that if you want to dabble in the mainframe world, that there were no free resources available. That has changed as of few couple months ago.

IBM's "Master the Mainframe" platform has been renamed to zXplore and been reopened.

Even better, completion of this course and one other super basic one on IBM's site opens you up to apply for a learner's license of z/OS (the dev&test environment that runs on Linux) itself, which can be had for $120 a year.

https://ibm.github.io/zdt-learners-edition-about/
stories.title: Tell HN: IBM's free z/OS classes return, license available after completion
We enhanced our UX and improved web performance at the Washington Post
'Maus' author reacts to his book being pulled from curriculum

stories.text:
I've been getting some of my sleeve expanded and I was in session yesterday, after a couple of hours I said it's crazy how little I'm bleeding on this one, and the tattoo artist said "yah, since the vaccine people don't bleed the same way anymore" and shrugged. I couldn't ask anything else about it because I got a pit in my stomach and waited till the end of the session and then dove in, the artist is young college age and has a group with other young tattoo artist, and they were laughing in it about how accurately they can nail how many doses people have had and when (including me) by how their skin and blood reacts to the tattoo.

Am I right to feel a bit weird about this?
stories.title: Ask HN: My tattoo artist made comment about the Covid vaccine that confused me
More Than 80% of NFTs Created for Free on OpenSea Are Fraud or Spam

stories.text:
1. From a user perspective: for most people, it's still a huge pain to organize everyday's flood of information. A good indicator is the huge amount of very popular "how-to-x" videos on YouTube.

2. A small group of people has very elaborate setups. They often use multiple tools, code plugins, or self-made solutions and after many iterations find their system. They often end up with amazing workflows and probably amazing outcomes.

In short, the potential is huge but most users don't reach it. It’s a pain for them because they struggle while they see others magically succeeding (on YouTube, Twitter, ...).
stories.title: Two learnings about the note-taking market and why it's just getting started
